result.execSummary:
The defendant Ian Raymond Wallin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court Costs are paid in full from cash bond previously posted.  The remaining portion of the cash bond has been refunded to the Poster.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 1:45 PM:  Defendant Ian Raymond Wallin in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions Def as to status of counsel.  Per Def:  States he cannot afford the retainer and has not yet been able to speak with SPD as his calls are not being returned.  Def would like to speak with ADA on possible resolution without counsel.  Off Record to speak with ADA.  Back of Record at 2:01 PM:  ADA recites resolution - Def to plead to Ct 1 with Ct 2 being DRI.  Def confirms resolution reached.    Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea Ct 1 OAR 1:  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Upon motion of the State, Ct 2 FTI IID DRI.  Statement by Def prior to SEH:  None offered.  The Court:  Accepts resolution and imposes Court Costs - $500 bond to be applied -  DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  Appeal Rights Given
Status conference on March 29, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

1:06 pm case called. Defendant Ian Raymond Wallin in court, in custody, appears via video.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court sets bond and sets for matter for adjourned initial appearance. Riverside Ruling in favor of the State. Court questions defendant regarding counsel. Defendant will be hiring his own counsel.  Status conference scheduled for March 29, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

Case called @ 3:33 p.m. Defendant Ian Raymond Wallin not in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Based on non appearance the Court authorizes the issuance of a bench warrant extraditable within the State of Wisconsin. 15TR876 - Default Judgment entered. Court orders: $175.30 forfeiture w/ 60 DTP or PP.
from DE requesting adjournment - Granted by the court
No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

1:13 pm case called. Defendant Ian Raymond Wallin in court, in custody, appears via video.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant wishes to have counsel. NGP entered by court.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
